availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bullitt County, Kentucky, physician and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Romelia McKay. Father of Charles McKay and George P. McKay. Owned six enslaved persons in Bullitt County in 1860. Physician and farmer in Bullitt County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, District 1, p. 13. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, Shepherdsville, District 1, p. 2. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, Shepherdsville, p. 4. Find A Grave, "Samuel A. McKay (1809-1888)," Memorial #26827893, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/26827893/samuel-adams-mckay (accessed August 21, 2018).
